intro: Lithocardium brevispicatum, commonly known as the short-spined lithocardium, is a succulent plant native to arid regions of southern Africa. It belongs to the family Aizoaceae, which is characterized by its fleshy leaves and adaptations to dry environments. The plant typically grows close to the ground, forming dense clusters with small, spiny stems. Its leaves are thick and fleshy, serving as water storage structures to help it survive in drought conditions. The flowers, which are usually yellow or orange, appear in small clusters and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
